Cary.Page-Walker Hotel: The Page-Walker Hotel, also known as The Page-Walker Arts & History Center is a historic house museum and former hotel located in Cary, North Carolina. The founder of the town of Cary, Allison Francis Page, built the Second Empire style hotel about 1868, and J. R. Walker bought it later. Page's son, Walter Hines Page (1855–1918) was an American journalist, publisher, and diplomat.
